alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 09 at 1:07PM EDT until August 09 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: .A frontal boundary will stall near the Pennsylvania/West Virginia border later today and linger in the area through Thursday. Expect numerous showers and thunderstorms capable of producing heavy rainfall. Flash flooding is possible in areas where multiple rounds of heavy rain occur. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Ohio, including the following areas, Monroe and Noble. Portions of southwest Pennsylvania, including the following areas, Fayette, Greene and Higher Elevations of Fayette. Portions of West Virginia, including the following areas, Eastern Preston, Marion, Marshall, Monongalia, Preston, Ridges of Eastern Monongalia and Northwestern Preston and Wetzel. * WHEN...Through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
